page.title: 09Village Life in Cardington
page.content:
When the school closed in 1984 many of the village people were very upset. The school had been open since 1868. They were worried that no new families with children would move into the village.
When we did a survey of the village, we asked local people why they liked living in Cardington. They all said it was quiet except in the morning and evening when people were going to work.
If they owned a car they were alright but otherwise they had to rely on the hourly bus service to Bedford. With no shop in the village, apart from the post office, everyone has to leave at sometime to buy food.
